JEE6 Dive Log
-------------------

Environment Setup:
1) Install MySQL
2) Create Database & User
3) Install JBoss AS7 or Red Hat EAP6
4) Configure Datasource in standalone.xml
		<datasource jndi-name="java:jboss/datasources/MysqlDS" pool-name="MysqlDS" enabled="true" use-java-context="true">
		    <connection-url>jdbc:mysql://127.10.101.1:3306/jee6divelog</connection-url>
		    <driver>mysql</driver>
		    <security>
		        <user-name>jee6divelog</user-name>
		        <password>jee6divelog1</password>
		    </security>
		</datasource>
		<drivers>
		    <driver name="mysql" module="com.mysql">
		        <xa-datasource-class>com.mysql.jdbc.jdbc2.optional.MysqlXADataSource</xa-datasource-class>
		    </driver>
		</drivers>
		
Build & Test:
1) mvn clean install

Deploy:
1) place .war file in deployments directory

Technology Used:
Unit tests are written using JUnit 4, Mockito 1.9, and PowerMock 1.4.
Integration tests are written using Arquillian 1.2.
name: Jee6divelog
tagline: DiveLog application based on JEE6 running on OpenShift
